title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has a confusing message.
OB: When invoking the New Java Package function, a message appears at the top stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' even when the package name field is empty. This message is unclear and raises questions about its meaning and whether it is an error. It is also suggested that the message should be displayed in red with the error icon.
EB: When invoking the New Java Package function, if the package name field is empty, the message stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should not appear. If there are any errors related to the package name field, they should be displayed in red with the error icon for better visibility and clarity.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Invoke the New Java Package function.
2. Leave the package name field empty.
3. Observe the appearance of the message stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'.
